Trait: Enveloped, spherical, about 50 nm in diameter. The surface proteins are arranged in an icosahedral-like symmetry.
Non-enveloped. Small, icosahedral, about 60 nm in size. A single molecule of circular dsDNA is contained within the T=7 icosahedral capsid, which is composed of 72 pentamers.
Enveloped, spherical to pleomorphic, 150-200 nm in diameter. Capsid consists of 162 capsomers and is surrounded by an amorphous tegument. Glycoproteins complexes are embedded in the lipid envelope.
Enveloped. Spherical to pleomorphic, about 80-100 nm in diameter. Mature capsid is quasi-icosahedral.
Enveloped, spherical to pleomorphic, 150-200 nm in diameter. Capsid consists of 162 capsomers and is surrounded by an amorphous tegument. Glycoproteins complexes are embeded in the lipid envelope.
